2024 Operational Referendum 2024 Facilities Referendum Public School Funding Home > ABOUT > Board of Education Board of Education About the Board of Education The Madison Board of Education is a seven-member policymaking body. Members are elected in April to serve staggered three-year terms in office.¬†Our Strategic Framework lays out a roadmap for our work. Regular Board meetings are generally held on the last Monday of the month, beginning at 6 p.m. Special meetings and work groups typically hold meetings one a month. Contact the Board of Education To reach all seven board members, please use the following group e-mail address: board@madison.k12.wi.us . All Board of Education members will receive your email and may use it to inform their¬†decisions and/or actions. Please know that a member of the Superintendent‚Äôs Team will receive and may respond to emails sent to this address. Meeting Agendas and Notices All Meeting Agendas and notices are hosted on BoardDocs¬†(updated at noon on Fridays). Board Policies All board policies are hosted on BoardDocs. Board Meeting Access You can watch/listen to virtual meetings at the Madison Board of Education YouTube Channel . An archive of meetings is available as well. The community is invited to attend meetings in person at the Doyle Administration Building. Details about speaking to the Board or providing written comments during¬†public input time are available on our website . Citizens' Ad Hoc Naming Committee - New southside elementary school Citizens' Ad Hoc Naming Committee - New southside elementary school Thanks to the community‚Äôs investment in our public schools during the 2020 referendum, the district constructed a new elementary school connected to Badger Rock Middle School. The new school, which opened fall 2023, has temporarily been called Southside Elementary until a permanent name is chosen. On Monday, May 6, the MMSD Board of Education voted to establish a 12-person committee for the purpose of naming the district's newest elementary school located at 501 E. Badger Road (currently referred to as Southside Elementary). The Ad Hoc Citizens‚Äô Naming Committee is given the charge to follow Board Policy 6700 and move through the school naming process. This committee will follow the policy and make final recommendations to a Board of Education Work Group on the soonest date possible after the final meeting of this ad hoc committee. Board of Education Members To reach all seven board members, please use the following group e-mail address: board@madison.k12.wi.us . Members of the Madison Board of Education are elected in April and serve staggered three-year terms. Nichelle Nichols, President Maia Pearson, Vice President Blair Mosner Feltham, Treasurer Ali Janae Muldrow, Clerk Nicki Vander Meulen, Member Savion Castro, Member Martha Siravo, Member Claire Li, Student Representative Lily Shapiro, Alternate Student Representative Nichelle Nichols, President Nichelle Nichols Seat 5 Contact Information nichellenichols@madison.k12.wi.us 608-658-5252 School Assignments Elem:¬† Elvehjem, Huegel, Lake View, Van Hise Middle: Wright High:¬†¬† East District-Wide: Shabazz Term Expires April 2028 Maia Pearson, Vice President Maia Pearson Seat 1 Contact Information mpearson2@madison.k12.wi.us 608-663-1659 School Assignments Elem:¬† Henderson, Lindbergh, Lori Mann Carey, Midvale, Schenk Middle: Sennett, Sherman High:¬† West Term Expires April 2027 Blair Mosner Feltham, Treasurer Blair Mosner Feltham Seat 6 Contact Information email: blfeltham@madison.k12.wi.us phone: TBD School Assignments Elem:¬†¬† Crestwood, Franklin, Kennedy, Marquette, Orchard Ridge Middle:¬† Badger Rock, Toki District-Wide: IAE Term Expires April 2026 Ali Janae Muldrow, Clerk Ali Janae Muldrow Seat 4 Contact Information 2706 Milwaukee St. (53704) ajmuldrow@madison.k12.wi.us 608-213-6579 School Assignments Elem:¬† Chavez, Gompers, Lincoln, Mendota, Shorewood Middle: O‚ÄôKeefe District- Wide: Metro Term Expires April 2028 Nicki Vander Meulen, Member Nicki Vander Meulen Seat 7 Contact Information 309 W. Washington Ave., Unit 204 (53703) nkvander@yahoo.com 608-332-2807 School¬†Assignments Elem:¬† Emerson, Olson, Randall, Thoreau Middle: Black Hawk, Hamilton, Whitehorse District-Wide:¬† Memorial Term Expires April 2026 Savion Castro, Member Savion Castro Seat 2 Contact Information sjcastro@madison.k12.wi.us 608-800-1994 School Assignments Elem:¬† Anana, Hawthorne, Nuestro Mundo, Sandburg, Stephens Middle: Cherokee Heights District-Wide:¬† Capital High Term Expires April 2027 Martha Siravo, Member Martha Siravo Seat 3 Contact Information msiravo@madison.k12.wi.us 920-248-0969 School Assignments Elem:¬† Lapham, Leopold, Lowell, Muir Middle: Gillespie, Spring Harbor High:¬† La Follette Term Expires April 2028 Claire Li, Student Representative Claire Li Contact information: cjli2@madison.k12.iw.us School Assignments: All Schools Term Expires: June 2026 Lily Shapiro, Alternate Student Representative Lily Shapiro Contact Information lrshapiro@madison.k12.wi.us School Assignments All Schools Term Expires June 2026 Board of Education Standing Work Groups Instruction Work Group - Committee of the Whole Operations Work Group - Committee of the Whole Instruction Work Group - Committee of the Whole Chairperson Ali Muldrow Staff Liaison Cindy Green Work Group Description This work group will focus specifically on the mission of the School District and will address matters and issues leading to the improvement of student learning, including curriculum, instruction, assessment, and intervention, as well as topics related to educator effectiveness. Work will also include the ongoing review and revision of policies related to the range of subject matter encompassed within the Work Group's domain. Operations Work Group - Committee of the Whole Chairperson Savion Castro Staff Liaison Bob Soldner Work Group Description This Work Group will focus on financial management, including budget planning; building and facilities maintenance, operations, and planning; land/property transactions; and District administrative operations, including human resource systems issues such as the retention and hiring of staff and staff equity issues. Work will also include the ongoing review and revision of policies related to the range of subject matter encompassed within the Work Group's domain. Previous Board of Education Ad Hoc Committees Citizens' Ad Hoc Renaming Committee - Jefferson Middle School Safety and Student Wellness Ad Hoc Committee Citizens' Ad Hoc Renaming Committee - Jefferson Middle School February 27, 2023 Update: The MMSD Board of Education voted to rename Thomas Jefferson Middle School to Ezekiel Gillespie Middle School, by a vote of 6-0, with Nicki Vander Meulen recused. The new name goes into effect beginning with the 2023-2024 school year. Jefferson Renaming - More Information Safety and Student Wellness Ad Hoc Committee March 2023 Update :¬†The Ad Hoc committee concluded its work in February 2023, sharing the committee's final recommendations at the March 13, 2023 Board of Education Operations Work Group Meeting . The Board of Education voted to officially receive the committee's recommendations at the March Regular meeting , held on March 22, 2023. The Board will continue to take up the recommendations during the budget process which concludes in June with a preliminary budget. This item will be part of the May 2023 Operations Work Group agenda as a separate discussion item. Other updates include answers to Board members' questions; a human resources update; construction updates; transportation updates; proposed consent agenda; great things happening around MMSD; and upcoming Board calendar. < > 545 W Dayton St. Madison WI 53703 General Info: (608) 663-1879 Students & Families: (608) 663-5241 Community: (608) 663-5310 Staff: (608) 663-5266 Espa√±ol: (608) 663-5428 Hmong: (608) 663-8433 Resources Calendars Careers Library Catalogs Madison School & Community Recreation (MSCR) (opens in new window/tab) Staff Directory Donate (opens in new window/tab) Staff Only (opens in new window/tab) Infinite Campus Contact Us Questions? We source each coffee through traceable, direct relationships with producers around the globe. Our team samples and chooses our favorite batches for our roastery, where each coffee is prepared for your enjoyment. Wherever you experience Madcap, we hope you‚Äôll see, sense, and taste the experience we work hard to create. ABOUT US Founded in 2008, Madcap Coffee Company is headquartered in Grand Rapids, MI. We operate our own roastery, as well as several cafes in Michigan. Our founder, Trevor Corlett, is an award-winning, nationally recognized barista and trainer. We have been spotlighted by national media and in competition for our coffees, roasting profiles, and innovative drink recipes. PURPOSE Since 2008, the Madcap mission has been to unveil the awe-inspiring craftsmanship, exquisite beauty, and human touch that goes into crafting every single cup of coffee, transforming an ordinary daily ritual into an elevated experience. SOCIAL RESPONSIBILITY Madcap Coffee Company differentiates itself through our coffee and roasting profiles, but also through our design-for-good mentality. At the heart of it, we believe that coffee ‚Äî from seed to cup ‚Äî should be a force for good. CAREERS We're a fast-growing company on the lookout for exceptional coffee and people. Come work with us. Staff and Board | Sustain Dane | Madison, WI ABOUT Staff and Board Job Opportunities Annual Impacts MEMBERSHIP Business Membership Nonprofit and Govt Membership Individual Membership Join a Workgroup View Our Members PROGRAMS Learn Accelerate Sustainability Workshop Sustainable Breakfast Series Recycle Better Program Water Steward Lunch and Learn Connect All Around Dane County Volunteering Take Action Farmers‚Äô Market Food Scrap Drop-off Climate Actions Restaurant Sustainability Efficiency Navigator Powerful Teen Leaders School Sustainability RESOURCES Newsletters Recycle Better Sustainability Stories Podcast Real-Time Air Quality Map SUMMIT CONTACT SUPPORT Select Page Staff and Board The Sustain Dane team is based in Madison, WI, and serves all of Dane County. Our board members represent a diverse group of businesses, nonprofits, and local governments that believe in a sustainable future. Meet Our Team Claire Oleksiak Executive Director As Executive Director Claire (she/her) aims to accelerate a sustainable environment and economy that benefits all members of our community. Claire is passionate about innovation, collaboration, and social impact. Prior to joining Sustain Dane, she worked as the Community Services Manager for the City of Madison Parks Division.¬† In that role, she facilitated partnerships with public and private organizations, managed community facilities, and implemented the Connecting Children to Nature Initiative. Claire also worked on local community and economic development in Washington, DC for 10 years. She¬†holds a bachelor‚Äôs degree from Cornell University and a master‚Äôs degree from Oxford University.¬†She grew up in Madison, WI. Reach out to Claire about strategic partnerships, your thoughts on sustainability opportunities and challenges, and any other questions related to Sustain Dane overall. Samantha Worden Program Manager Sam (she/her) is dedicated to fostering learning, connection, and collaboration through Sustain Dane‚Äôs programs and partnerships. She holds a bachelor‚Äôs degree in Biology and Environmental Studies from Butler University. At Sustain Dane, she develops and manages programs including our Accelerate Sustainability workshops, one-on-one assistance, and tracking of our partners‚Äô sustainable impacts. Previously she worked at Exact Sciences as a hydroponic farmer and implemented sustainability solutions within the culinary department. With a passion for food sustainability and circular economies, Sam is committed to creating impactful experiences that inspire action. In her free time, she enjoys exploring Madison‚Äôs outdoors, playing pickleball, and discovering new local restaurants. Reach out to Sam for more information on engaging with sustainability at your organization. Spencer Bierman Development & Partnership Manager Spencer (he/him) aims to develop relationships that increase Sustain Dane‚Äôs¬†connection to its members and¬†ensure that community members¬†are¬†supported in their journey to sustainability. Prior to joining Sustain Dane, Spencer worked at the Wisconsin Foundation and Alumni Association where he focused on¬†generating affinity for the University of Wisconsin ‚Äì Madison.¬†Spencer studied Community & Nonprofit Leadership¬†and Environmental Studies¬†at the University of Wisconsin ‚Äì Madison. After work you can find Spencer exploring natural areas, bouldering,¬†or painting. Reach out to Spencer for any questions regarding membership, sponsorship, grants, or powerful teen leaders. Sonali Bhikha Program Coordinator Sonali (she/her) is passionate about the intersection of collaboration, sustainability, and equity. She is dedicated to fostering inclusive and community-driven climate solutions. Her past experience focused on environmental justice programming in Duluth, MN. At Sustain Dane, Sonali coordinates programs that build connections and inspire action, including the Sustainable Breakfast Series, All Around Dane County, volunteer initiatives, and educating youth in schools. She also leads participant outreach and develops messaging that highlights community stories and program impact. She holds a bachelor‚Äôs degree in Sustainability Studies from the University of Texas at Austin. Sonali is especially excited to advance sustainability efforts that center equity and justice through collective action. In her free time, she enjoys spending time with her friends and family, reading, and exploring Madison‚Äôs parks and trails. Reach out to Sonali for any questions regarding our programs. Frankie Fosdick Efficiency Navigator Frankie (he/him) aims to drive work to address housing resilience, equity, and climate change.¬†¬†Frankie has a bachelor‚Äôs degree in business administration from Southern New Hampshire University.¬†¬†Prior to working at Sustain Dane, Frankie worked at Special Olympics and is forever grateful for the experience and all the athletes that he got to know so well.¬† ¬†Outside of Sustain Dane, Frankie enjoys spending time outside with his dogs, friends, and family and watching/playing sports. Reach out to Frankie for any questions regarding our Efficiency Navigator program. Marcus Johnson Powerful Teen Leaders Program Manager Marcus Johnson(he/him) currently attends Operations Fresh Start‚Äôs Academy program and is working towards his urban forestry pre-apprenticeship. As the Powerful Teen Leaders program assistant Marcus aims to facilitate positive relationships with the outdoors while having more youth conscious of conservation efforts. In addition to being a water treatment operator for the ARMY reserves, Marcus previously worked as a water treatment operator for Wisconsin Whey Protein. In his free time, he enjoys caring for his four cats and honing his skills in plant identification around Madison. Job Opportunities You can play a critical role in helping Sustain Dane achieve our vision of a thriving and connected community with a sustainable environment and economy we are proud to pass on to future generations. We aren‚Äôt currently hiring but you may send your resume to hello@sustaindane.org to be considered for future job opportunities.
